contact_department: Chair for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
data_processing: Basecalling was performed with the real time analysis (RTA) package within the Genome Analyzer Sequencing Control Software (SCS2.10).
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) including on-column DNase digestion 48 h after transfection. Poly-A RNA was isolated from total RNA using the NEBNext Poly(A)mRNA Magnetic Isolation Module (E7490).
growth_protocol_ch1: IMEC cell lines were grown in DMEM/F-12 with appropriate supplements. HMLE cells were kept in MEGM medium.
title: rep1_cd44low_dox
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cell were infected with the indicated doxycycline-inducible constructs and treated with Dox or EtOH as solvent control. HMLE cells were additionally sorted according to CD44 & Cd24 surface markers.

data_processing: All data normalization and selection of fold-changed genes were performed using GeneSpringGX 7.3 (Agilent Technology, USA). The averages of normalized ratios were calculated by dividing the average of normalized signal channel intensity by the average of normalized control channel intensity. Functional annotation of genes was performed according to Gene OntologyTM Consortium (http://www.geneontology.org/index.shtml) by GeneSpringGX 7.3. Gene classification was based on searches done by BioCarta (http://www.biocarta.com/), GenMAPP (http://www.genmapp.org/), DAVID (http://david.abcc.ncifcrf.gov/), and Medline databases (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/).
description: Gene expression of LPS-stimulated nasal fibroblasts for 12hr
extract_protocol_ch1: Nasal fibroblasts were exposed to LPS (10 μg/mL) for 12 h. Total RNA was isolated using Trizol reagent (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA). For control and test RNAs, synthesis of target cRNA probes and hybridization were performed using the Low RNA Input Linear Amplification kit (Agilent Technology, Santa Clara, CA). Hybridized images were scanned using a DNA microarray scanner and quantified using Feature Extraction Software (Agilent). All data normalization and selection of fold-change of the genes were performed using GeneSpringGX 7.3 (Agilent).
growth_protocol_ch1: Nasal fibroblasts were isolated from surgical tissues and cultured.
hyb_protocol: After checking labeling efficiency, fragmentation of cRNA was performed by adding 10X blocking agent and 25X fragmentation buffer and incubating at 60oC for 30 min. The fragmented cRNA was resuspended with 2X hybridization buffer and directly pipetted onto assembled Agilent’s Canine Oligo Microarray (44K). The arrays hybridized at 65oC for 17 hours using Agilent Hybridization oven (Agilent Technology, USA). The hybridized microarrays were washed as the manufacturer’s washing protocol (Agilent Technology, USA).
label_protocol_ch1: Amplified and labeled cRNA was purified on cRNA Cleanup Module (Agilent Technology) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Labeled cRNA target was quantified using ND-1000 spectrophotometer (NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Wilmington, DE).
scan_protocol: The hybridized images were scanned using Agilent’s DNA microarray scanner and quantified with Feature Extraction Software (Agilent Technology, Palo Alto, CA).
title: lipopolysaccharide treated sample replication 2
treatment_protocol_ch1: Freshly drawn nasal fibroblasts were treated with lipopolysaccharide (10 μg/mL).   The cultures were incubated for 12 hours at 37 ºC in a humidified incubator with 5% CO2.

characteristics_ch1: protocol: exposed to side-stream cigarette smoke
data_processing: RNA-Seq reads were aligned to the mouse genome (UCSC Genome; Assembly NCBI37/mm9) using STAR
extract_protocol_ch1: Lungs were cleared of BALF content, the trachea removed and the more distal lung lobe tissue enriched by dissection. The interstitial cells were collected and reacted with anti-CD45 antibody coupled to magnetic beads before depletion of the CD45+ cells using an autoMACS cell separator .The purity was (>95% epCAM+, <1% CD31+ endothelial cells) and viability (<5% 7-AAD (viability stain)

contact_institute: Federal Research Center of Pediatric Hematology, Oncology and Immunology
data_processing: The data were normalised using preprocessCore quantile normalisation in R. Each culture (highly and low sensitive to the virus) was normalized separately
extract_protocol_ch1: We collected the cells 3 hours after infection. Total RNA was extracted using TRIzol Reagent.
growth_protocol_ch1: The cells were propagated in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM, PanEco, Moscow, Russia) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS, PanEco), 2 mM L-glutamine and 50 ug/ml gentamicin at 37°C in 5% CO2. The cells were maintained by regular passages when confluence was reached. To obtain cells in G0 phase of cell cycle the cells of both lines were cultured in DMEM with 0.2% FBS for 48 hours.
hyb_protocol: Standard Illumina hybridization protocol
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was reverse-transcribed to cDNA and cRNA using the Ambion TotalPrep cRNA Amplification Kit (Invitrogen, USA). The cRNA concentration was quantified and adjusted to 150 ng/ml using an ND-1000 Spectrophotometer (NanoDrop Technologies, USA)
scan_protocol: Standard Illumina scanning protocol
title: Infected Highly Sensitive 3 hours without infection
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells HELF- 977 and HAF-1608 synchronized in G0 phase were infected with HCMV at multiplicity of infection of 3 or mock-infected. Viral inoculum was added to the cells and allowed to adsorb for 60 min at 37°C in 5% CO2. Then virus inoculum was removed and replaced with fresh medium.

label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was reverse-transcribed to cDNA and cRNA using the Ambion TotalPrep cRNA Amplification Kit (Invitrogen, USA). The cRNA concentration was quantified and adjusted to 150 ng/ml using an ND-1000 Spectrophotometer (NanoDrop Technologies, USA)
scan_protocol: Standard Illumina scanning protocol
title: Infected Low Sensitive 3 hours after infection
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells HELF- 977 and HAF-1608 synchronized in G0 phase were infected with HCMV at multiplicity of infection of 3 or mock-infected. Viral inoculum was added to the cells and allowed to adsorb for 60 min at 37°C in 5% CO2. Then virus inoculum was removed and replaced with fresh medium.

contact_institute: Federal Research Center of Pediatric Hematology, Oncology and Immunology
data_processing: The data were normalised using preprocessCore quantile normalisation in R. Each culture (highly and low sensitive to the virus) was normalized separately
extract_protocol_ch1: We collected the cells 3 hours after infection. Total RNA was extracted using TRIzol Reagent.
growth_protocol_ch1: The cells were propagated in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM, PanEco, Moscow, Russia) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS, PanEco), 2 mM L-glutamine and 50 ug/ml gentamicin at 37°C in 5% CO2. The cells were maintained by regular passages when confluence was reached. To obtain cells in G0 phase of cell cycle the cells of both lines were cultured in DMEM with 0.2% FBS for 48 hours.
hyb_protocol: Standard Illumina hybridization protocol
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was reverse-transcribed to cDNA and cRNA using the Ambion TotalPrep cRNA Amplification Kit (Invitrogen, USA). The cRNA concentration was quantified and adjusted to 150 ng/ml using an ND-1000 Spectrophotometer (NanoDrop Technologies, USA)
scan_protocol: Standard Illumina scanning protocol
title: Norm Highly Sensitive
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells HELF- 977 and HAF-1608 synchronized in G0 phase were infected with HCMV at multiplicity of infection of 3 or mock-infected. Viral inoculum was added to the cells and allowed to adsorb for 60 min at 37°C in 5% CO2. Then virus inoculum was removed and replaced with fresh medium.

characteristics_ch1: tissue: clear cell renal cell carcinoma
data_processing: Raw data was processed by MAS.5 (Affymetrix) and analyzed using GeneSpring GX10
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted from flash frozen patient tissue samples (RCC tissue and matched normal kidney tissue) using TRIzol (Invitrogen) and chloroform (Sigma). All tumor samples are from the primary tumor site. RNA extracts were purified on Spin Chroma column (BD bioscience K1332-2). The 18S/28S bands were verified on a 1% agarose gel. RNA samples were shipped to Advanced Genomic Technology Center Gene Expression Core at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN for further analysis. RNA quality was assessed by Agilent Bioanalyzer (Santa Clara, CA). Reverse transcription to second strand cDNA was generated from 100 ng of good quality total RNA.
hyb_protocol: The IVT products were column-purified, fragmented, and hybridized onto Affymetrix U133 Plus 2.0 GeneChips® at 45º C for 16 h.
label_protocol_ch1: The RNA products were column-purified (Affymetrix) and then in vitro transcribed to generate biotin-labeled cRNA.
scan_protocol: Subsequent to hybridization, the arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin, then scanned in an Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 3000 (Santa Clara, CA). All control parameters were confirmed to be within normal ranges before normalization and data reduction was initiated.

All tumor samples are from the primary tumor site. RNA extracts were purified on Spin Chroma column (BD bioscience K1332-2). The 18S/28S bands were verified on a 1% agarose gel. RNA samples were shipped to Advanced Genomic Technology Center Gene Expression Core at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN for further analysis. RNA quality was assessed by Agilent Bioanalyzer (Santa Clara, CA). Reverse transcription to second strand cDNA was generated from 100 ng of good quality total RNA.
hyb_protocol: The IVT products were column-purified, fragmented, and hybridized onto Affymetrix U133 Plus 2.0 GeneChips® at 45º C for 16 h.
label_protocol_ch1: The RNA products were column-purified (Affymetrix) and then in vitro transcribed to generate biotin-labeled cRNA.
scan_protocol: Subsequent to hybridization, the arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin, then scanned in an Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 3000 (Santa Clara, CA). All control parameters were confirmed to be within normal ranges before normalization and data reduction was initiated.

extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted from flash frozen patient tissue samples (RCC tissue and matched normal kidney tissue) using TRIzol (Invitrogen) and chloroform (Sigma). All tumor samples are from the primary tumor site. RNA extracts were purified on Spin Chroma column (BD bioscience K1332-2). The 18S/28S bands were verified on a 1% agarose gel. RNA samples were shipped to Advanced Genomic Technology Center Gene Expression Core at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN for further analysis. RNA quality was assessed by Agilent Bioanalyzer (Santa Clara, CA). Reverse transcription to second strand cDNA was generated from 100 ng of good quality total RNA.
hyb_protocol: The IVT products were column-purified, fragmented, and hybridized onto Affymetrix U133 Plus 2.0 GeneChips® at 45º C for 16 h.
label_protocol_ch1: The RNA products were column-purified (Affymetrix) and then in vitro transcribed to generate biotin-labeled cRNA.
scan_protocol: Subsequent to hybridization, the arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin, then scanned in an Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 3000 (Santa Clara, CA). All control parameters were confirmed to be within normal ranges before normalization and data reduction was initiated.

data_processing: Raw data was processed by MAS.5 (Affymetrix) and analyzed using GeneSpring GX10
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted from flash frozen patient tissue samples (RCC tissue and matched normal kidney tissue) using TRIzol (Invitrogen) and chloroform (Sigma). All tumor samples are from the primary tumor site. RNA extracts were purified on Spin Chroma column (BD bioscience K1332-2). The 18S/28S bands were verified on a 1% agarose gel. RNA samples were shipped to Advanced Genomic Technology Center Gene Expression Core at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN for further analysis. RNA quality was assessed by Agilent Bioanalyzer (Santa Clara, CA). Reverse transcription to second strand cDNA was generated from 100 ng of good quality total RNA.
hyb_protocol: The IVT products were column-purified, fragmented, and hybridized onto Affymetrix U133 Plus 2.0 GeneChips® at 45º C for 16 h.
label_protocol_ch1: The RNA products were column-purified (Affymetrix) and then in vitro transcribed to generate biotin-labeled cRNA.
scan_protocol: Subsequent to hybridization, the arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin, then scanned in an Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 3000 (Santa Clara, CA). All control parameters were confirmed to be within normal ranges before normalization and data reduction was initiated.

title: 217N

data_processing: Raw data was processed by MAS.5 (Affymetrix) and analyzed using GeneSpring GX10
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted from flash frozen patient tissue samples (RCC tissue and matched normal kidney tissue) using TRIzol (Invitrogen) and chloroform (Sigma). All tumor samples are from the primary tumor site. RNA extracts were purified on Spin Chroma column (BD bioscience K1332-2). The 18S/28S bands were verified on a 1% agarose gel. RNA samples were shipped to Advanced Genomic Technology Center Gene Expression Core at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN for further analysis. RNA quality was assessed by Agilent Bioanalyzer (Santa Clara, CA). Reverse transcription to second strand cDNA was generated from 100 ng of good quality total RNA.

label_protocol_ch1: The RNA products were column-purified (Affymetrix) and then in vitro transcribed to generate biotin-labeled cRNA.
scan_protocol: Subsequent to hybridization, the arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin, then scanned in an Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 3000 (Santa Clara, CA). All control parameters were confirmed to be within normal ranges before normalization and data reduction was initiated.
title: HRE 101N

data_processing: Raw data was processed by MAS.5 (Affymetrix) and analyzed using GeneSpring GX10
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted from flash frozen patient tissue samples (RCC tissue and matched normal kidney tissue) using TRIzol (Invitrogen) and chloroform (Sigma). All tumor samples are from the primary tumor site. RNA extracts were purified on Spin Chroma column (BD bioscience K1332-2). The 18S/28S bands were verified on a 1% agarose gel. RNA samples were shipped to Advanced Genomic Technology Center Gene Expression Core at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN for further analysis. RNA quality was assessed by Agilent Bioanalyzer (Santa Clara, CA). Reverse transcription to second strand cDNA was generated from 100 ng of good quality total RNA.
hyb_protocol: The IVT products were column-purified, fragmented, and hybridized onto Affymetrix U133 Plus 2.0 GeneChips® at 45º C for 16 h.
label_protocol_ch1: The RNA products were column-purified (Affymetrix) and then in vitro transcribed to generate biotin-labeled cRNA.
scan_protocol: Subsequent to hybridization, the arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin, then scanned in an Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 3000 (Santa Clara, CA). All control parameters were confirmed to be within normal ranges before normalization and data reduction was initiated.

contact_institute: UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS HLTH SCI CTR HOUSTON
data_processing: The raw data were exported from Illumina GenomeStudio (no background subtraction was performed).  The data were log2 transformed and normalized by quantiles using BRB-Array Tools.
extract_protocol_ch1: We extracted total RNA utilizing RNeasy Fibrous Tissue (Qiagen) according to manufacturer’s instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: A 3mm punch skin biopsy was obtained from the arm of study subjects.
hyb_protocol: We incubated the cRNA with HYB buffer with the BeadChips at 58C for 17 hours and washed according to the Illumina Whole-Genome Gene Expression Direct Hybridization Assay Guide.
label_protocol_ch1: Using the Ambion Illumina TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion #IL1791), we reverse-transcribed 300 ng of total RNA using a T7 oligo-dT primer, used the resulting cDNA to synthesize the complement strand, purified, and in vitro transcribed biotinylated cRNA.
scan_protocol: We incubated each BeadChip with Cy3-Streptavidin for 10 min, dried, and then scanned on an Illumina BeadArray Scanner.
title: PATIENT01
treatment_protocol_ch1: The samples were put immediately in RNALater (Qiagen).

description: Gene expression data from mammary fibroblasts with Ets2 deletion and no oncogene present in epithelial cells
extract_protocol_ch1: Trizol extraction of total RNA was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: Fibroblasts were isolated from mammary gland tissue using a modified protocol for gravity separation.
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, 15 ug of cRNA was hybridized for 16 hours at 45ºC on Mouse Genome 430A 2.0 GeneChips.  GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 400.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA was prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 2 ug total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2005, Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000.
source_name_ch1: Fibroblasts isolated from mammary gland with Ets2 deletion in fibroblasts and no oncogene present in epithelial cells
title: Ets2 null fibroblasts with no oncogene present in epithelial cells
treatment_protocol_ch1: Fibroblasts were grown in 10% FBS DMEM in a 37º incubator with 7% CO2.

characteristics_ch1: cell line: Lung Epithelial Cell Line MLE15
data_processing: CEL files were summarized using Affymetrix Expression Console (current version 1.1). Expression estimates were derived from the probe level hybridization intensities using the Robust Multi-Array Analysis (RMA) algorithm.  Differential expression between experimental and control samples was examined using Welch's T-test and a False Discovery Rate correction.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated using QIAGEN’s RNeasy kit (Qiagen) and the sample integrity was verified using RNA 6000 Nano Assay RNA chips run in Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies).
growth_protocol_ch1: MLE-15 cells (provided by Dr. J. Whitsett, Children’s Hospital Medical Center, Cincinnati, OH) are murine lung epithelial cells produced from tumors in transgenic mice expressing the SV40 large tumor antigen under transcriptional control of the human surfactant protein C promoter (SP-C) (34). Cells were maintained in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM) (Life Technologies, Inc.), 10% heat-inactivated fetal bovine serum (FBS) (Life Technologies, Inc.), 100 units/ml penicillin G, 100 mg/ml streptomycin sulfate.
hyb_protocol: The labeled fragmented DNA was hybridized to the GeneChip Mouse Gene Array 1.0ST (Affymetrix) for 16-18 h in a GeneChip Hybridization oven 640 at 45°C with constant rotation (60 rpm). The hybridized samples were washed and stained using Affymetrix fluidics station 450. The first stain with streptavidin-R-phycoerythrin (SAPE) was followed by signal amplification using a biotinylated goat anti-streptavidin antibody and another SAPE staining (Hybridization, Washing and Staining Kit, Affymetrix).
label_protocol_ch1: The total RNA (300 ng) was reverse transcribed using Whole Transcript cDNA Synthesis kit (Affymetrix). The cDNA obtained was used as a template for in vitro transcription using a Whole Transcript cDNA Amplification Kit (Affymetrix). The antisense cRNA obtained was purified using GeneChip Sample Cleanup Module (Affymetrix) and used as a template for reverse transcription (Whole Transcript cDNA Synthesis kit, Affymetrix) to produce single-stranded DNA in the sense orientation. During this step, dUTP was incorporated. Then, the DNA was fragmented using uracil DNA glycosylase (UDG) and apurinic/apyrimidinic endonuclease 1 (APE 1), labeled with DNA Labeling Reagent and covalently linked to biotin using terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase (TdT, Whole Transcript Terminal Labeling kit, Affymetrix). IVT and cDNA fragmentation quality controls were performed by an mRNA Nano assay in the Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer.
scan_protocol: Affymetrix GeneArray Scanner 3000 7G Plus
title: Grhl2 downregulation in MLE 15 cells 1
treatment_protocol_ch1: To knockdown Grhl2 gene expression, a replication incompetent, VSV-G pseudotyped lentiviral vector that contained a GFP tracking reporter gene along with either a non-targeting control shRNA (RHS4346) or the shRNA targeting Grhl2 (V2LMM_20130) was employed (Open Biosystems). Lentiviruses were packaged and concentrated as described previously (19). MLE-15 cell infections with lentiviral vectors were performed for 16 h in the presence of polybrene (5 μg/ml) at a multiplicity of infection of 50. Stable cell lines were generated by puromycin dihydrochloride (5 μg/ml, Sigma) selection for 6 days.

MLE-15 cell infections with lentiviral vectors were performed for 16 h in the presence of polybrene (5 μg/ml) at a multiplicity of infection of 50. Stable cell lines were generated by puromycin dihydrochloride (5 μg/ml, Sigma) selection for 6 days.

characteristics_ch1: cell line: Lung Epithelial Cell Line MLE15
data_processing: CEL files were summarized using Affymetrix Expression Console (current version 1.1). Expression estimates were derived from the probe level hybridization intensities using the Robust Multi-Array Analysis (RMA) algorithm.  Differential expression between experimental and control samples was examined using Welch's T-test and a False Discovery Rate correction.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated using QIAGEN’s RNeasy kit (Qiagen) and the sample integrity was verified using RNA 6000 Nano Assay RNA chips run in Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies).
growth_protocol_ch1: MLE-15 cells (provided by Dr. J. Whitsett, Children’s Hospital Medical Center, Cincinnati, OH) are murine lung epithelial cells produced from tumors in transgenic mice expressing the SV40 large tumor antigen under transcriptional control of the human surfactant protein C promoter (SP-C) (34). Cells were maintained in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM) (Life Technologies, Inc.), 10% heat-inactivated fetal bovine serum (FBS) (Life Technologies, Inc.), 100 units/ml penicillin G, 100 mg/ml streptomycin sulfate.
hyb_protocol: The labeled fragmented DNA was hybridized to the GeneChip Mouse Gene Array 1.0ST (Affymetrix) for 16-18 h in a GeneChip Hybridization oven 640 at 45°C with constant rotation (60 rpm). The hybridized samples were washed and stained using Affymetrix fluidics station 450. The first stain with streptavidin-R-phycoerythrin (SAPE) was followed by signal amplification using a biotinylated goat anti-streptavidin antibody and another SAPE staining (Hybridization, Washing and Staining Kit, Affymetrix).
label_protocol_ch1: The total RNA (300 ng) was reverse transcribed using Whole Transcript cDNA Synthesis kit (Affymetrix). The cDNA obtained was used as a template for in vitro transcription using a Whole Transcript cDNA Amplification Kit (Affymetrix). The antisense cRNA obtained was purified using GeneChip Sample Cleanup Module (Affymetrix) and used as a template for reverse transcription (Whole Transcript cDNA Synthesis kit, Affymetrix) to produce single-stranded DNA in the sense orientation. During this step, dUTP was incorporated. Then, the DNA was fragmented using uracil DNA glycosylase (UDG) and apurinic/apyrimidinic endonuclease 1 (APE 1), labeled with DNA Labeling Reagent and covalently linked to biotin using terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase (TdT, Whole Transcript Terminal Labeling kit, Affymetrix). IVT and cDNA fragmentation quality controls were performed by an mRNA Nano assay in the Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer.
scan_protocol: Affymetrix GeneArray Scanner 3000 7G Plus
title: Control 2
treatment_protocol_ch1: To knockdown Grhl2 gene expression, a replication incompetent, VSV-G pseudotyped lentiviral vector that contained a GFP tracking reporter gene along with either a non-targeting control shRNA (RHS4346) or the shRNA targeting Grhl2 (V2LMM_20130) was employed (Open Biosystems). Lentiviruses were packaged and concentrated as described previously (19). MLE-15 cell infections with lentiviral vectors were performed for 16 h in the presence of polybrene (5 μg/ml) at a multiplicity of infection of 50. Stable cell lines were generated by puromycin dihydrochloride (5 μg/ml, Sigma) selection for 6 days.

characteristics_ch1: tissue: Dorsal section of lumbar spinal cord
data_processing: fastx_clipper from FASTX Toolkit v0.0.14 was employed to remove the adapter sequence from raw sequencing read, reads shorter than 18 bp were removed
extract_protocol_ch1: The animals were sacrificed 30 days post-surgery, and lumbar DRG (L3 to L5) and dorsal horn of corresponding spinal cord section were extracted and frozen at -80 °C. Tissues from ten animals were pooled per sample and two independent replicates were made for each of the four conditions. Pooled tissue were lysed in lysis buffer containing cyclohexamide and the lysate was divided into two fractions. One fraction was used to purify poly(A) mRNA for RNA-seq and the remaining fraction was used to isolate ribosome footprints. For the former, poly(A) mRNA were purified using magnetic oligo-dT DynaBeads. The purified RNA was then subjected to alkaline fragmentation. Fragmented mRNAs were size-selected on a denaturing 10% polyacrylamide-urea gel and the bands corresponding to 30–50 nucleotides were excised, eluted, and precipitated with Isopropanol. For the later, lysate was treated with RNAse 1 followed by ultracentrifugation through a sucrose cushion. The resulting RNA pellet was resuspended in Tris HCl buffer and purified by double acid Phenol and one Chloroform extraction. Purified RNA was resolved on a 15% polyacrylamide urea gel and bands corresponding to 28–32 nucleotides, containing the desired ribosome footprints (RFPs), was excised and extracted for RNA using Costar Spin-X columns (Sigma).
growth_protocol_ch1: C57BL/6J female mice, at 8 weeks of age
source_name_ch1: Dorsal section of lumbar spinal cord
title: SC_SNI_mRNA_1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Mice underwent the bilateral Spared Nerve Injury surgical procedure. The mouse was returned to its home-cage for recovery. Sham animals were used as controls, where the surgical procedure was carried out identically but all three branches of the sciatic nerve were left untouched and unharmed.

title: N4_liver_normal diet_4 weeks
treatment_protocol_ch1: QHD group were fed with HFD for 4 weeks followed by daily gavage of 0.1ml/kg QHD in addition to HFD for additional 4 weeks; rats in the GC group were fed with HFD for 4 weeks followed by daily gavage of a mixture of geniposide and chlorogenic acid (weight ratio) in addition to HFD for additional 4 weeks.  All rats were sacrificed for tissue collection at the end of 4-week therapy.

treatment_protocol_ch1: QHD group were fed with HFD for 4 weeks followed by daily gavage of 0.1ml/kg QHD in addition to HFD for additional 4 weeks; rats in the GC group were fed with HFD for 4 weeks followed by daily gavage of a mixture of geniposide and chlorogenic acid (weight ratio) in addition to HFD for additional 4 weeks.  All rats were sacrificed for tissue collection at the end of 4-week therapy.

contact_institute: University of Colorado - Anschutz Medical Campus
data_processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software (Agilent) using default parameters to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Features flagged in Feature Extraction as Feature Non-uniform outliers were excluded. Signal intensities were normalized using combined rank consistency filtering with LOWESS intensity normalization in Agilent Feature Extraction software. Data was subsequently analyzed by GeneSpring (Agilent).
description: Gene expression 2hrs after incubation with no neutrophils
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was prepared using TRIzol reagent (Invitrogen) following the manufacturer's recommendations. RNA was quantified using a NanoDrop-1000 spectrophotometer and quality was monitored with the Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA).
growth_protocol_ch1: T84 intestinal epithelia were cultured in DMEM/F12 with 10% FCS at 37oC with 5% CO2. Experimental cells were seeded and grown to confluence (TER>1,000 Ohms.cm2) on the underside of 3cm2 3um-pore Transwell permeable supports (Corning).
hyb_protocol: 1.65 ug of Cy3-labelled cRNA (specific activity >7.0 pmol Cy3/ug cRNA) was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 55 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 55 ul of 2x Agilent hybridization buffer was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to Agilent Whole Human Genome Oligo Microarrays (G4112F) for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately by brief centrifugation.
label_protocol_ch1: Cyanine-3 (Cy3) labeled cRNA was prepared from 0.2 ug RNA using the One-Color Quick Amp Labeling kit (Agilent) according to the manufacturer's instructions, followed by RNAeasy column purification (QIAGEN). Dye incorporation and cRNA yield were checked with a NanoDrop ND-1000 Spectrophotometer.
scan_protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent DNA Microarray Scanner using one color scan setting for 4x44k array slides (Scan resolution 10um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
title: Direct -PMN 1
treatment_protocol_ch1: On day of experiment monolayers were transferred to Hanks Buffered Saline, with 1uM fMLP on the apical surface (bottom chamber), to establish chemotactic gradient. Neutrophils were freshly isolated from healthy volunteer venous blood and used for either direct or indirect migration.

contact_department: Medicine- Division of Digestive and Liver Diseases
data_processing: Data was normalized using the GCRMA algorithm as implemented in Bioconductor/R.
description: Gene expression of colonic mucosa of 6 week old mice
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA were purified with Trizol reagent
growth_protocol_ch1: Mice were maintained at all times on a 12-hour light-dark cycle in a pathogen-free environment with free access to rodent chow and water.
hyb_protocol: 10 μg of RNA dissolved in 300 μL of buffer was hybridized to Mouse Genome 430. 2.0 GeneChips (Affymetrix). All samples were prepared with the standard protocol recommended by the manufacturer.
label_protocol_ch1: DNA was synthesized with the One-cycle cDNA Synthesis kit (Affymetrix). The cDNA was the used as a template for the synthesis of biotin labeled cRNA with IVT MEGAscript® T7 Kit.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned on an Affymetrix Scanner 3000-7G scanner with GCOS software. Scanning was peformed according to the protocol described in the Affymetrix GeneChip® Expression Analysis Technical Manual, November 2004 Edition.
source_name_ch1: WT C57BL/6 mice,colonic mucosa, sacrificed at 6 weeks
title: WT rep 1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Mice were sacrificed at 6 weeks, colonic mucosa was isolated with PBS injection into submucosa.

data_processing: BioConductor Limma package.
extract_protocol_ch1: The cells were collected by adding 1ml 1X trypsin-EDTA (Trypsin 10X, 15400-054 Invitrogen) to the flasks followed by 4-5 min incubation at 37°C. Trypsin was inhibited by adding 1ml MEM+10% FCS and the cells were collected by centrifugation at 9.600x g for 5 min. The pellet was washed with 500µl 1X PBS and RNA was extracted using RNeasy Plus Mini kit (74134, QIAGEN).
growth_protocol_ch1: Caco-2 cells (American Cell Type Collection, HTB-37, Rockville, MD, USA) were kindly provided by Prof. M. Mäki (University of Tampere, Tampere, Finland). Cells were maintained in minimum essential medium (MEM, 31095-029 GIBCO) supplemented with 1X sodium pyruvate (NaPy 100X, 11360-039 GIBCO), 1% Pen-Strep (Pen-Strep, 15070-063 GIBCO), 1X non-essential amino acids (NEAA 100X, 11140-035 GIBCO) and 10% fetal calf serum (FCS, C-37350 PROMOCELL) in 75cm2 flasks (353136 BD Biosciences) and were routinely split every 5 days. For stimulations, 3x105 cells were seeded in 25 cm2 flasks (156367, nunc) in 3ml MEM+1% FCS and incubated at 37°C with 5% CO2 in the air. On the third day of seeding, before stimulations the undifferentiated Caco-2 cells were washed once with 1X phosphate-buffered saline (PBS).
hyb_protocol: The hybridization was done according to manufacturer´s instructions and using the protocol One-Color Microarray-Based Gene Expression Analysis -protocol version 5.5, February 2007.
label_protocol_ch1: The labeling was done according to manufacturer´s instructions and using the protocol One-Color Microarray-Based Gene Expression Analysis -protocol version 5.5, February 2007.
scan_protocol: Microarrays were washed and scanned with Agilent Scanner  using manufacturer provided protocols. Feature Extraction software was used for image analysis.
title: p3143_rep1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Bovine serum albumin (BSA) was obtained from Sigma Aldrich (Albumin, bovine fraction V powder, A8806-1G Sigma Aldrich) and contained endotoxin at ≤ 0.1ng/mg. Lactalbumin was also obtained from Sigma Aldrich (Alpha-lactalbumin from bovine milk, 61289-50MG Sigma Aldrich), however information on endotoxin level in lactalbumin was not available. Pepsin- and trypsin- digested BSA (PT-BSA), pepsin- and trypsin- digested lactalbumin (PT-L), a blank pepsin- and trypsin- control (PT), where no substrate was used for digestion, and PT-G were prepared as described earlier (Lindfors,K. 2008). An endotoxin test was performed on PT-G and PT-BSA using a Limulus Amebocyte Lysate (LAL), Pyrogent plus single test kit (cat no. N289-06, CAMBREX). No endotoxin was found in PT-G, but PT-BSA tested positive for endotoxin.  Lyophilised PT, PT-BSA, PT-L and PT-G were dissolved in MEM+1% FCS and filter sterilised by passing through 0.22µm pore filter (SLGS033SS, Millipore). Similarly the synthetic peptides p31-43 (LGQQQPFPPQQPY) and the immunogenic peptide p57-68 (QLQPFPQPQLPY) (New England Peptide LLC, USA) were dissolved in MEM+1% FCS to achieve a final concentration of 150µg/ml. PT, PT-BSA and PT-L were used as negative controls for PT-G treatment. The cells were stimulated for six hours with a particular stimulant dissolved in 2ml MEM+1% FCS. The control cells (MED-CTL) were kept in MEM+1% FCS for six hours. In total, four identical but independent experiments were performed with cells differing in 1-2 passages between each experiment.

Lyophilised PT, PT-BSA, PT-L and PT-G were dissolved in MEM+1% FCS and filter sterilised by passing through 0.22µm pore filter (SLGS033SS, Millipore). Similarly the synthetic peptides p31-43 (LGQQQPFPPQQPY) and the immunogenic peptide p57-68 (QLQPFPQPQLPY) (New England Peptide LLC, USA) were dissolved in MEM+1% FCS to achieve a final concentration of 150µg/ml. PT, PT-BSA and PT-L were used as negative controls for PT-G treatment. The cells were stimulated for six hours with a particular stimulant dissolved in 2ml MEM+1% FCS. The control cells (MED-CTL) were kept in MEM+1% FCS for six hours. In total, four identical but independent experiments were performed with cells differing in 1-2 passages between each experiment.

data_processing: BioConductor Limma package.
extract_protocol_ch1: The cells were collected by adding 1ml 1X trypsin-EDTA (Trypsin 10X, 15400-054 Invitrogen) to the flasks followed by 4-5 min incubation at 37°C. Trypsin was inhibited by adding 1ml MEM+10% FCS and the cells were collected by centrifugation at 9.600x g for 5 min. The pellet was washed with 500µl 1X PBS and RNA was extracted using RNeasy Plus Mini kit (74134, QIAGEN).
growth_protocol_ch1: Caco-2 cells (American Cell Type Collection, HTB-37, Rockville, MD, USA) were kindly provided by Prof. M. Mäki (University of Tampere, Tampere, Finland). Cells were maintained in minimum essential medium (MEM, 31095-029 GIBCO) supplemented with 1X sodium pyruvate (NaPy 100X, 11360-039 GIBCO), 1% Pen-Strep (Pen-Strep, 15070-063 GIBCO), 1X non-essential amino acids (NEAA 100X, 11140-035 GIBCO) and 10% fetal calf serum (FCS, C-37350 PROMOCELL) in 75cm2 flasks (353136 BD Biosciences) and were routinely split every 5 days. For stimulations, 3x105 cells were seeded in 25 cm2 flasks (156367, nunc) in 3ml MEM+1% FCS and incubated at 37°C with 5% CO2 in the air. On the third day of seeding, before stimulations the undifferentiated Caco-2 cells were washed once with 1X phosphate-buffered saline (PBS).
hyb_protocol: The hybridization was done according to manufacturer´s instructions and using the protocol One-Color Microarray-Based Gene Expression Analysis -protocol version 5.5, February 2007.
label_protocol_ch1: The labeling was done according to manufacturer´s instructions and using the protocol One-Color Microarray-Based Gene Expression Analysis -protocol version 5.5, February 2007.
scan_protocol: Microarrays were washed and scanned with Agilent Scanner  using manufacturer provided protocols. Feature Extraction software was used for image analysis.

data_processing: Data were evaluated using the R software and the limma package from BioConductor. Pathway analyzes were done using the ranks of the test statistics  based on the KEGG.db annotation package.
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was purified using RNeasy Mini Kit following the company’s instructions (Qiagen). Total RNA from two independent experiments was pooled.
growth_protocol_ch1: Human NSCLC adenocarcinoma cell lines A549 (ATCC-No.: CCL-185) were obtained from the American Type Culture Collection and maintained in RPMI 1640 (E15-840, PAA Laboratories GmbH) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (Greiner BioOne), at 37 C in humidified atmosphere containing 5% CO2 in air. The cell lines were authenticated by microsatellite profiling (DSMZ, Germany).
hyb_protocol: Cy3- and Cy5-labeled RNAs were hybridized overnight to Agilent Human Whole Genome 4x44K arrays (G4112F) and further processed following the Agilent protocol.
label_protocol_ch1: 1µg per pool was labeled by fluorescent dye Cy3 and Cy5 using dual-color QuickAmp kit (Agilent) according to the instructions matching a balanced dye-swap design.
scan_protocol: Slides were scanned using the GenePix 4100A scanner (Axon Instruments, Downingtown, PA) at 5 µm resolution.
title: C12.1h repl. 1
treatment_protocol_ch1: For photon irradiation (X-ray) a 6 MV X-ray beam generated by a clinical linear accelerator (dose rate of 3 Gy/min) was used. Carbon-ion irradiations (12C) using the intensity controlled raster scanning system (25) were performed with a homogeneous 10 mm (for cells) or 40 mm (for tumor) spread-out Bragg peak (SOBP) with an energy of 120.45-135.16 MeV/u (cells) and 122.36-183.74 MeV/u (tumor) on target obtained from the SIS accelerator (GSI Helmholtzzentrum für Schwerionenforschung). Mean dose average of LET was 50 70 keV/µm.

data_processing: The raw intensity data were preprocessed by Affymetrix's Expression Console (version 1.1)
description: Gene expression data from wild-type lung cells
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was purified using an Absolutely RNA Purification Kit (Agilent Technologies), and amplified using the WT-Ovation Pico RNA Amplification System (Nugen) to generate cDNA
growth_protocol_ch1: Primary lung cells were purified from 4 month old female mice; no ex vivo growth of cells prior to RNA extraction
hyb_protocol: Fragmented, biotinylated cDNA was hybridized for 18 hours on Mouse 430_2 Affymetrix Mouse Genome 430 2.0 Arrays.  The arrays were then washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin, using the Affymetrix GeneChip Fluidics Station 450
label_protocol_ch1: The purified cDNA (5ug per sample) was fragmented and biotinylated using FL-Ovation cDNA Biotin Module V2 (Nugen, cat# 4200-12)
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned using an Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000
title: Bmi1 wild-type lung cells, biological replicate 3
treatment_protocol_ch1: To make a total lung cell suspension, lungs were infused with dispase, then 1% agarose and lungs removed from animal; lungs were then minced, further digested with collagenase/dispase, treated with dnase, filtered, and red blood cells lysed.  Cells were then labeled with 7aad, anti-CD31 and anti-CD45 antibodies, and FACS-purified to exclude endothelial, hematopoietic, and dead cells (See Kim et al, 2005).

data_processing: The raw intensity data were preprocessed by Affymetrix's Expression Console (version 1.1)
description: Gene expression data from mutant lung cells
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was purified using an Absolutely RNA Purification Kit (Agilent Technologies), and amplified using the WT-Ovation Pico RNA Amplification System (Nugen) to generate cDNA
growth_protocol_ch1: Primary lung cells were purified from 4 month old female mice; no ex vivo growth of cells prior to RNA extraction
hyb_protocol: Fragmented, biotinylated cDNA was hybridized for 18 hours on Mouse 430_2 Affymetrix Mouse Genome 430 2.0 Arrays.  The arrays were then washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin, using the Affymetrix GeneChip Fluidics Station 450
label_protocol_ch1: The purified cDNA (5ug per sample) was fragmented and biotinylated using FL-Ovation cDNA Biotin Module V2 (Nugen, cat# 4200-12)
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned using an Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000

Cells were then labeled with 7aad, anti-CD31 and anti-CD45 antibodies, and FACS-purified to exclude endothelial, hematopoietic, and dead cells (See Kim et al, 2005).

data_processing: The raw intensity data were preprocessed by Affymetrix's Expression Console (version 1.1)
description: Gene expression data from wild-type lung cells
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was purified using an Absolutely RNA Purification Kit (Agilent Technologies), and amplified using the WT-Ovation Pico RNA Amplification System (Nugen) to generate cDNA
growth_protocol_ch1: Primary lung cells were purified from 4 month old female mice; no ex vivo growth of cells prior to RNA extraction
hyb_protocol: Fragmented, biotinylated cDNA was hybridized for 18 hours on Mouse 430_2 Affymetrix Mouse Genome 430 2.0 Arrays.  The arrays were then washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin, using the Affymetrix GeneChip Fluidics Station 450
label_protocol_ch1: The purified cDNA (5ug per sample) was fragmented and biotinylated using FL-Ovation cDNA Biotin Module V2 (Nugen, cat# 4200-12)
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned using an Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000
title: Bmi1 wild-type lung cells, biological replicate 2
treatment_protocol_ch1: To make a total lung cell suspension, lungs were infused with dispase, then 1% agarose and lungs removed from animal; lungs were then minced, further digested with collagenase/dispase, treated with dnase, filtered, and red blood cells lysed.  Cells were then labeled with 7aad, anti-CD31 and anti-CD45 antibodies, and FACS-purified to exclude endothelial, hematopoietic, and dead cells (See Kim et al, 2005).

extract_protocol_ch1: Liver samples were fixed in 10% formalin, embedded in paraffin and sectioned (thickness of 2µm). Slides were stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) and assessed by an expert pathologist (RM).
hyb_protocol: Standard Affymetrix protocol
label_protocol_ch1: Standard Affymetrix protocol
scan_protocol: Standard Affymetrix protocol using a Gene chip scanner 3000
title: Liver Transcriptome from CTROLS_613
treatment_protocol_ch1: Secondary biliary cirrhosis was induced by common bile duct ligation (CBDL). Briefly, under general anesthesia with midazolam (5mg/kg body weight, i.p., Laboratory Reig Jofre, Barcelona, Spain) and ketamine (100mg/kg body weight, i.p., Imalgene, Barcelona, Spain) the common bile duct was isolated and double ligated with 5-0 silk thread. The first ligature was made below the junction of the hepatic ducts and the second one above the pancreatic ducts. Finally, the portion between the two ligatures was resected. Rats received weekly injections of vitamin K and were studied 4 weeks after the surgery. In the drug treated groups simvastatin was suspended in distilled water and administered by gavage (5mg/kg body weight) once a day from 3 days before the final study. Simvastatin inhibits the HMG-CoA activity in the liver as early as 30 min after oral administration, with a peak of inhibitory activity at one hour. Experiments were performed 1 h after the last dose of the drug.

contact_address: No. 8 GongTi Southern Road, Chao Yang District
contact_department: Department of Respiratory Medicine and Critical Care Medicine
contact_institute: Beijing Chao-Yang Hospital Affiliated to Capital Medical University
data_processing: Affymetrix® microarray data were collected with Affymetrix® GeneChip® Command Console® Software. Probe values were corrected for background and normalized via quantile normalized by Robust Multichip Average (RMA) of the Bioconductor 'affy' package.In the detection column, calls include P for Present, A for Absent, and M for Marginal.
description: Gene expression data from lung of wild-type mice 14d post Pneumocystis infection.
extract_protocol_ch1: Trizol extraction of total RNA was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: After euthanasia, the left lobe of mice lung was excised and then frozen in liquid nitrogen quickly. The tissuse was then transferrd to a -80℃ freezer.
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, 12.5 ug of cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45℃ on Affymetrix® GeneChip® Mouse Genome 430 2.0 Array. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 450.
label_protocol_ch1: 100ng RNA was amplified and labeled using the MessageAmp™ Premier RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion, AM1792) according to the manufacturer's instructions..
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000.
source_name_ch1: left lung of wild-type mice with Pneumocystis infection
title: Lung of Pneumocystis infected mice,biological rep1
treatment_protocol_ch1: 14 days before Pneumocystis infection, the group of dexamethasone-treated PCP mice were given 4mg/l dexamethasone and 1 mg/ml tetracycline in drinking water consecutively until euthanasia. Both dexamethasone-treated and wild-type PCP mice were inoculated intratracheally with 1 × 10^6 Pneumocystis nuclei and control mice were given lung homogenate from uninfected scid mice. 14 days after infection, mice were sacrified and the left lung was excised.

data_processing: For RNA-Seq data quality control was performed by Fastqc. Before downstream analysis, low quality reads and adaptor contamination were deleted. RNA-Seq data mapping was performed by Tophat2 and hg19 as reference genome. Gene assemble and expression quantification was performed by Cufflinks.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted by using Qiagen RNA extraction kit according to manufacturer’s manual, and then 10ug total RNA was used for downstream library construction. For ChIP asssy, approximately 1×107 cells were fixed with 1% formaldehyde and quenched by glycine. The cells were washed three times with PBS and then harvested in ChIP lysis buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, pH7.6, 1 mM CaCl2, 0.2% Triton X-100). DNA was digested to 150-300 bp by MNase (SIGMA) before extensive centrifugation. Four volume of ChIP dilution buffer (20 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 150 mM NaCl, 2 mM EDTA, 1% Triton X-100, 0.1% SDS) was added to the supernatant. The resulted lysate was then incubated with protein G beads and antibodies at 4ºC over night. The beads were washed 5 times and DNA was eluted by Chip elution buffer (0.1 M NaHCO3, 1% SDS, 20 µg/ml proteinase K). The elution was incubated at 65ºC over night and DNA was extracted with DNA purification kit (TIANGEN).
title: HMC_L.T.R_siKDM3A_RNASeq

data_processing: The data were analyzed with the Bioconductor package Affy using RMA method for normalizing and summarizing probe level intensity measurements.
description: Gene expression data from liver of wild-type mouse
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNAs from either Piz and wild-type livers were purified by QIAshredder (Qiagen spa, Milano, Italy, catalog no. 79656) and extracted with RNeasy Protect Mini Kit (Qiagen, catalog no. 74126) using standard conditions.
growth_protocol_ch1: Animal procedures were performed in accordance to regulations of the Italian Ministry of Health. PiZ transgenic mice were maintained on a C57/BL6 background.
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, 10 ug of biotinylated cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45°C on GeneChip Mouse 430A_2 Array
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared using the GeneChip IVT labelling kit (Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the GeneChip® Scanner 3000 .
title: Control, biological replicate 2

data_processing: The microarray data were analyzed using the GeneSpring GX software (Agilent). The data were summarized, log2 transformed and normalized with the Robust Multi-array Analysis (RMA) algorithm. Only probe sets with signal intensities above the 20th percentile in at least one of the 6 microarrays performed were retained, whereas all other probe sets were excluded from further analyses. Subsequently, the signal intensities of the replicate microarrays performed for each mouse group (SPC-HAxTCR-HA, SPC-HA) were averaged and the fold changes were calculated in reference to the data from the SPC-HA group. Only probe sets with a fold change greater than or equal to ±2 were retained. All other probe sets were excluded from further analyses. Finally, 378 transcripts were found to be differentially expressed in SPC-HAxTCR-HA vs. SPC-HA lungs. 326 of those were up-regulated and 52 were down-regulated.
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated using RNeasy Midi Kit together with the RNase free DNase kit (both from Qiagen) for DNA-digestion according to manufacturer's instructions. RNA was photometrically quantified on a NanoDrop devive and RNA integrity was checked on an Agilent2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent).
hyb_protocol: Samples were hybridized on the GeneChip® Mouse Gene 1.0 ST array (Affymetrix) according manufacurer's recommendations.
label_protocol_ch1: Synthesis, labeling and fragmentation of cRNA was performed using the GeneChip® 3’ IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix) according to manufacurer's protocols.
scan_protocol: Microarrays were scanned with an Affymetrix GCS 3000 scanner running with GCOS v1.1.1 software.
title: SxT_lung_2
treatment_protocol_ch1: Sample preparation comprised perfusion of the lung with about 10 ml of sterile PBS and subsequent lysis of the tissue in RLT lysis-buffer (Qiagen) and a tissue homogenizer.

description: See Agilent Cat#740100 for product details
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using the miRVana total RNA isolation kit (Ambion) using the manufacturer's instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: Cells were grown at 37C in 5%CO2 using DMEM media supplemented with 10%FBS + 1mM L-glutamine. Cells were passaged every 3 days and grown for several passages before RNA extraction.
hyb_protocol: Each cy5 labeled testing sample was mixed with equal amount cy3-labeled reference sample and fragmented and blocked (Agilent Gene Expression Hybridization Kit),  and samples were applied to microarrays enclosed in Agilent SureHyb-enabled hybridization chambers. After hybridization, slides were washed sequential
label_protocol_ch1: The testing RNA samples and universal mouse reference RNA (Agilent) were labeled with CTP-cy5 and CTP-cy3, respectively, Using Agilent Quick Amp Labeling Kit.
scan_protocol: Scanned on an Agilent G2565BA scanner.

characteristics_ch1: C57BL/6NIA Mice, 18months of age, Standard Diet, Ad Lib, Liver
data_processing: Data from both channels was extracted using the Agilent Feature Extractor Software, Version 7.5.  Due to potential variation of the Cy-5 dye we prefer to analyze the green channel alone and use single channel data.  Results for control probes were first removed, multiple repeats of any probe were averaged, then each array was z-normalized.  Differently expressed genes were identified between the 3 sample groups and pathway enrichment analysis was conducted using Diane 6.0, an in-house microarray analysis program.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted with the Qiagen RNEasy Columns
hyb_protocol: 17 hour incubation following Agilent protocols using 750ng of both Cy3 and Cy5 labeled material, In Situ Hybridization Kit reagents and control probes followed by a 10 minute room temperature wash in 6X SSC,0.005% tritonX-102 and 5 minutes at 4 degrees C in 0.1X SSC, 0.005% Triton X-102. The arrays were dried in a Nitrogen stream and scanned.
label_protocol_ch1: Agilent low RNA Input Linear Amplification Kit using Cyanine-3-CTP
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned using an Agilent Scanner G2565AA .

data_processing: Basecalls performed using GAPipeline or CASAVA
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was harvest using RNeasy and miRNeasy Qiagen kits.
growth_protocol_ch1: ES cells were cultured on irradiated MEFs in DMEM, 15% FBS media containing LIF (ESGRO) at 37oC with 5% CO2. For RNA-Seq experiments ES cells were cultured on gelatin-coated dishes in ES cell media containing 1.5 µM CHIR9901 (GSK3 inhibitor) for several passages to remove feeder cells. ES cells were passed by washing with PBS, and dissociating with trypsin. For embryoid body (EB) formation, ES cells were cultured in low attachment binding dishes to promote 3D formation in ES cell media without LIF.
title: EB_d6_shLuc_ctrl (RNA-Seq)

data_processing: Affymetrix Expression Console version 1.1 was used to generate the .cel files. Partek Genomics Suite 6.5 (Partek Inc., St. Louis, MO) was used to perform data analysis. Robust multi-chip analysis (RMA) normalization was done on the entire data set.
description: Gene expression data of normal mouse tracheal epithelium replicate 2
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted using RNeasy Micro kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer's instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: Mice tracheas were cleaned well, cut into pieces and incubated in Dispase at RT for 23min. Digestion was stopped by addition of DMEM with 5% FBS. Epithelium was peeled off with forceps and incubated in 0.1% trypsin, 1.6mM EDTA 20 min at 37 °C.Mouse CD45 MicroBeads (Miltenyi Biotec) were used to deplete CD45+ leukocytes from mouse tracheal epithelial cells.
hyb_protocol: Targets were hybridized to GeneChip® Mouse Genome 430 2.0 arrays in Affymetrix GeneChip® hybridization oven 645, washed in Affymetrix GeneChip®  Fluidics Station 450.
label_protocol_ch1: Hybridization targets were prepared with MessageAmp™ Premier RNA Amplification Kit (Applied Biosystems/Ambion, Austin, TX) from total RNA.
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned with Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 7G and AGCC software version 1.1
title: control epithelium, biological rep2
treatment_protocol_ch1: Adult mice were placed in individual compartments within a chamber and exposed to 500 ppm SO2 in air for 4 hr.

data_processing: Affymetrics probeset summaries were computed using RMA algorithm.  Data were then imported to BRB-ArrayTools and subsequent data filtering, median normalization and statistical analyses were performed using this software.
extract_protocol_ch1: Trizol extraction of total RNA was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions.
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, 10 to 18 µg (mean 12.8) of cRNA hybridized for 16 hr at 45°C on Affymetrics Human U133 Plus 2 arrays. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 450
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA was prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 50 ng total RNA (GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2005-2006, Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using GeneArray Scanner 3000_7Gplus

extract_protocol_ch1: Trizol extraction of total RNA was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions.
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, 10 to 18 µg (mean 12.8) of cRNA hybridized for 16 hr at 45°C on Affymetrics Human U133 Plus 2 arrays. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 450
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA was prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 50 ng total RNA (GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2005-2006, Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using GeneArray Scanner 3000_7Gplus

characteristics_ch1: tissue: gastric lymph node (left pancreatic lymph node)
data_processing: Data was processed using GeneSpring GX 10 Software. Data was imported using the enhanced Agilent FE Import setting. Spot information in Feature Extraction was used to flag data, and normalization was performed using "per spot and per chip: intensity dependent (Lowess) normalization".  Data obtained for the Cy5-labelled GLN sample were divided by the Cy3-labelled PDLN sample to obtain ratios shown in the "PRE_VALUE" column of processed data. Raw data show log2 of ratio.
extract_protocol_ch1: Gastric lymph node was excised and immediately homogenized in Trizol Reagent.  RNA was extracted in Trizol and then purified using the RNeasy kit (Qiagen). RNA purity and quality was assessed using the NanoDrop 1000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Scientific), Agilent RNA 6000 Nano Reagents, RNA Nano chips, and the Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies), according to manufacturer's instructions.
hyb_protocol: Two color microarrays were performed using the whole mouse genome 4x44K Oligo microarray kit (Agilent, series 2514868).  Hybridization was performed using the Agilent Gene Expression Hybridization Kit and the Agilent Microarray Hybridization Chamber as instructed by the manufacturer. Samples were hybridized for 17 h at 65C, and slides were washed with Gene Expression Wash Buffer (Agilent) according to maufacturer's instructions.
label_protocol_ch1: RNA was amplified, labeled with Cy5 and combined with spike B using the Agilent low RNA input fluorescence linear amplification kit (Agilent Technologies). The amplified cRNA was purified using the RNeasy kit (Qiagen), and specific activity was determined with the NanoDrop 1000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Scientific).
scan_protocol: Microarray chips were scanned using the DNA microarray scanner (Agilent) with the following parameters: 2 color scan; scan resolution 5 um, single pass, red and green dye channels.  Data was extracted using Feature Extraction software.
title: Gene expression in GLN vs PDLN (NOD mouse #2)

data_processing: Statistical analysis was done with the statistical computing environment R. Additional software packages (affy, geneplotter, multtest, and vsn) were taken from the Bioconductor project.  Microarray preprocessing: Probe level normalization was conducted using the variance stabilization method (vsn) from Huber et al..
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA were extracted with the RNeasy Micro Kit from Qiagen. RNA was amplified using the Ovation Pico WTA System V2 from NUGEN applied for 40ng total RNA.
growth_protocol_ch1: Huh-7.5 cells were grown in complete DMEM at a confluency of 70% prior to treatment.
hyb_protocol: Human Gene 1.0 ST arrays (Affymetrix) were hybridized with 5.5 mg labelled cDNA.
label_protocol_ch1: Samples were labelled with Encore biotin module (NUGEN) washed and stained using the HWS Kit (Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: Affymetrix Gene ChIP Scanner 3000 7G

data_processing: The raw data were normalized by the log scale robust multi-array analysis (RMA) method with the Expression Console software version 1.1 (Affymetrix).
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA in the samples was isolated using Trizol Reagent according to the manufacture's protocol.
growth_protocol_ch1: The cells were cultured in DMEM medium containing 10% FBS, 50U/mL penicillin and 50μg/mL streptomycin at 37℃ with 5% CO2 incubator. The cell line tested negative for any mycoplasma contamination.
hyb_protocol: Total RNA was processed for double-strand cDNA synthesis, IVT and aRNA fragmentation with GeneChip 3’IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA, USA) according to the manufacturer’s instruction. Then, it was processed for hybridization at 45℃ for 17 h with The PrimeView™ Human Gene Expression Array (Affymetrix). The arrays were washed in the GeneChip Fluidic Station 450 (Affymetrix).
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol(GeneChip® 3' IVT PLUS Reagent Kit, Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: The arrays were scanned by the GeneChip Scanner 3000 (Affymetrix).
source_name_ch1: U87 cells infected with negative control-shRNA lentivirus
title: U87 cell as normal control, biological rep3
treatment_protocol_ch1: U87 cells in 6-well plates were infected with lentiviral particles containing either shCON or shPHF20. The virus containing culture medium was replaced with fresh DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS at 12h after infection. 72h post lentivirus infection, two U87 cell groups were set up: KD (knockdown, cells infected with PHF20-shRNA lentivirus) and NC (negative control, cells infected with negative control-shRNA lentivirus).

extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA in the samples was isolated using Trizol Reagent according to the manufacture's protocol.
growth_protocol_ch1: The cells were cultured in DMEM medium containing 10% FBS, 50U/mL penicillin and 50μg/mL streptomycin at 37℃ with 5% CO2 incubator. The cell line tested negative for any mycoplasma contamination.
hyb_protocol: Total RNA was processed for double-strand cDNA synthesis, IVT and aRNA fragmentation with GeneChip 3’IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA, USA) according to the manufacturer’s instruction. Then, it was processed for hybridization at 45℃ for 17 h with The PrimeView™ Human Gene Expression Array (Affymetrix). The arrays were washed in the GeneChip Fluidic Station 450 (Affymetrix).
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol(GeneChip® 3' IVT PLUS Reagent Kit, Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: The arrays were scanned by the GeneChip Scanner 3000 (Affymetrix).

data_processing: Using a HiSeq SBS sequencing kit version 4, Fastq files were generated and demultiplexed with with the bcl2fastq v2.17.1.14 Conversion Software (Illumina).

title: AAV-TBG-WT FXR #1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Eight week-old FXR floxed male mice were injected via the tail vein with 100 µl of a mixture of purified AAV serotype 8 (AAV8) containing a liver-specific TBG promoter driving Cre recombinase and either AAV8-TBG-FXR WT or AAV8-TBG-Y67F-FXR at 5 x1010 virus particles per mouse, and four weeks later, mice were fed 0.5% CA chow for 6 h to activate FXR signaling

data_processing: Data processing of arrays were performed using Illumina BeadStudio software. Gene expression data was normalized using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation. Sample Gene Profile option of Illumina BeadStudio was used to export to a data matrix.
description: Sample Gene Profile option of Illumina BeadStudio software was used to export to gene expression data based on unique gene.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from cells using the PureLink™ RNA Mini kit (Ambion) following the manufacturer protocol.
hyb_protocol: Labeled cRNA (750 ng per array) was hybridized to the Illumina HumanHT-12 v4 expression beadchip according to the manufacturer's procedure (Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA).
label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples were prepared for hybridization using TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX) following the sample labeling procedure: Total RNA (500 ng) was used for cDNA synthesis. Amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) was then performed to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA. Concentration of cRNA was then measured by spectrophotometer (Nanodrop, ND-1000)
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned using an Illumina Bead array Reader (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) following the manufacturer's procedure.
title: ActA0_3

data_processing: Background correction and normalization was performed using the RMA-Sketch implementation in Affymetrix Expression Console
extract_protocol_ch1: Tissues were dissected and flushed with ice‐cold HBSS. RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) following the manufacturer′s instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: Male mice only were used for the experiments. Mice were group housed up to five per cage with 12 h light/dark cycle with lights on at 6 a.m. Food and water were available ad libitum.
hyb_protocol: Biotinylated cRNA was hybridized on GeneChip® Mouse Gene 2.0 ST Arrays , that were stained, washed and scanned following standard procedures.
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was amplified using the Ovation PicoSL WTA System V2 and further processed using the Encore Biotin Module according to the instructions supplied by the manufacturer (NuGen).
scan_protocol: Biotinylated cRNA was hybridized on GeneChip® Mouse Gene 2.0 ST Arrays , that were stained, washed and scanned following standard procedures.
title: Splenocytes_18h_post_VSVinPBS (A912b_02)
treatment_protocol_ch1: For VSV-M2 infection mice were injected intravenously with 2 x 106 pfu VSV-M2 or mock infected with PBS. 7 μL of in vivo jetPEI was mixed with 50 μg of nucleic acids (MWG-BIOTECH AG) at a N:P ratio of 7:1 in a volume of 200 μL of 5 % glucose solution (vol/vol), and incubated for 15 min. Subsequently, 50 μg of complexed 5'-triphosphate RNA, the synthetic dsRNA analog poly(I:C) (Invivogen) was injected.

data_processing: Data was normalized in R (v.2.14.) with the bioconductor package affy(v.1.32.0) and the function RMA.
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA from isolatedCD4+ cells was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) according to the manufacturer's instructions. The RNA quality and quantity was determined with Agilent Bioanalyzer chips (Bio-Rad Laboratories).
growth_protocol_ch1: CD4+ cells were isolated by depleting the non-CD4+ cells (human CD4+CD25high isolation kit, Miltenyi Biotec). The purity of the isolated cells was determined by Flow cytometry analysis and was above 90%.
hyb_protocol: cRNA was hybridized to Affymetrix Human Gene 1.0 ST arrays.
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA (200 ng) was amplified and labeled with biotin using Affymetrix GeneChip Whole Transcript Sense Target Labeling Kit.
scan_protocol: Affymetrix scanner 3000 7g.

contact_institute: Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania
data_processing: Microarray data were analyzed using the Oligo package available at the Bioconductor website (www.bioconductor.org). The raw data were first background-corrected by the Robust Multichip Average (RMA) method and then normalized by an invariant set method. Probesets were considered expressed if at least one sample had a RMA expression value greater than the mean of the negative control probesets, 18,494 probesets were considered expressed.  Differential gene expression between the control and mutant mice was analyzed by the Limma package available at the Bioconductor website. P-values obtained from the multiple comparison tests were corrected by false discovery rates. Heatmap displays were created using the freely available MeV package ( http://www.tm4.org/mev/).
description: Gene expression data from P3 and adult type 2 alveolar epithelial cells isolated by cell sorting using YFP from SftpcCreERT2-R26REYFP mice and TdTomato+, EpCAM+, CD31-, CD45- from Axin2CreERT2-TdTomato mice
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted using Rneasy mini kit (Qiagene)
growth_protocol_ch1: Primary cell isolation
hyb_protocol: cDNAs were added to Affymetrix hybridization cocktails, heated at 99ºC for 2 min and hybridized for 16 h at 45ºC to GeneChips (Affymetrix Inc., Santa Clara CA). The microarrays were then washed at low (6X SSPE) and high (100mM MES, 0.1M NaCl) stringency and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin. Fluorescence was amplified by adding biotinylated anti-streptavidin and an additional aliquot of streptavidin-phycoerythrin stain.
label_protocol_ch1: 100ng of total RNA was converted to first-strand cDNA using reverse transcriptase primed by a poly(T) oligomer that incorporated the T7 RNA polymerase promoter. Second-strand cDNA synthesis was followed by in vitro transcription (Affymetrix One-Cycle Target Labeling Kit) for linear amplification and biotinylation of each transcript.
scan_protocol: A confocal scanner was used to collect fluorescence signal after excitation at 570 nm.
source_name_ch1: Cell sort P4 lung SP-C + cells
title: P4 SP-C+ AEC2s_1
treatment_protocol_ch1: No treatment

data_processing: Paired-end sequencing (150 bp for each read) was performed using HiSeq X with the depth of 24 million reads for each sample. Quality of sequenced reads were assessed using FastQC (https://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/). PolyA/T tails were trimmed using PRINSEQ (Schmieder and Edwards, 2011). Adaptor sequences were trimmed and shorter reads than 24 bp were dropped using Trimmomatic (Bolger et al., 2014). Reads were mapped to the mouse reference genome (mm10) using Hisat2 (Kim et al., 2015) with default setting. Duplicate reads were removed using the markdup option of SAMtools (Li et al., 2009). Fragments numbers were counted using the featureCounts option of SUBREAD (Liao et al., 2014).
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from FACS-sorted cells using TRIzol (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and Direct-zol RNA MicroPrep (Zymo Research).

data_processing: The Cy5 fluorescent intensity of each spot was analyzed by Genepix 4.1 software (Molecular Devices, Sunnyvale, CA). The signal intensity of each spot was corrected by subtracting background signals in the surrounding. We filtered out spots that signal-to-noise ratio was less than 0 or control probes. Spots that passed aforementioned criteria were normalized by the R program in the limma package using quantile normalization (Smyth, 2005).
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNAs were extracted from muscle, adipose tissue, and liver using RNeasy Mini kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA).
hyb_protocol: Cy5-labeled RNA targets were hybridized to the Mouse Whole Genome OneArrayTM (Phalanx Biotech Group, Hsinchu, Taiwan)
label_protocol_ch1: Fluorescence-labeled RNA targets were prepared from 5 μg of total RNA using MessageAmpTM aRNA kit (Ambion, Austin, TX, USA) and cyanine (Cy5) dye (Amersham Pharmacia, Piscataway, NJ, USA).
scan_protocol: The slides were scanned by an Axon 4000 scanner (Molecular Devices, Sunnyvale, CA).

data_processing: Raw signal intensities were initially screened by using the MaxD/View-Program to remove false positive and false negative signals (using a cut off of at least one P value for each transcript <0.2). The data were then normalized by using the global geometric mean (GGM) normalization option within the MaxD/View-Program

contact_institute: The University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey
data_processing: The data were generated using the Affymetrix Scanner according to Affymetrix protocol. The intensities are from MAS5.0
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from 70% confluent cell cultures using the RNeasy (QIAGEN) kit.
growth_protocol_ch1: Cell cultures were maintained at 37°C in a humidified atmosphere of 5% CO2 and 95% air. MDA-MB-231 and 231wCFry cells were cultured in Advanced DMEM with 10% heat inactivated FBS, 100 μg/ml penicillin-streptomycin solution.
hyb_protocol: SPIA product and fragmented cDNA are analyzed by electrophoresis using the Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100 to assess the appropriate size distribution prior to microarray hybridization. 3.75ug of amplified and labeled cDNA was used in the hybridization cocktail for GeneChip analysis. Detailed protocols for sample preparation suing the NuGEN Ovation amplification and labeling kits can be found at http://www.nugeninc.com.
label_protocol_ch1: Microarray experiments (GEO Accession numbers pending paper acceptance) were performed by the Bionomics Research and Technology Center at EOHSI (UMDNJ, Piscataway, NJ). Forty nanograms of total RNA from each sample were used to generate a high fidelity cDNA for array hybridization.  The cDNA were amplified, fragmented and labeled with biotin using NuGEN Ovation Amplification and Labeling kit V2 (NuGEN, San Diago, CA).
scan_protocol: All samples were subjected to gene expression analysis via the Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 high-density oligonucleotide array which currently queries over 47,000 transcripts.  Hybridization, staining and washing of all arrays were performed in the Affymetrix fluidics module as per the manufacturer’s protocol.  Streptavidin phycroerythrin stain (SAPE, Molecular Probes) was the fluorescent conjugate used to detect hybridized target sequences. The detection and quantitation of target hybridization was performed with a GeneArray Scanner 3000 (Affymetrix) All arrays referred to in this study were assessed for “array performance” prior to data analysis.
title: MDA_MB_231-not_transfected-3
treatment_protocol_ch1: The 10,791 base pair COP rat Fry cDNA (GenBank accession number EU563851.1) was cloned in four sections and then reconstructed in the expression vector which was inserted into the pEGFP-N1 plasmid. The cells were transfected and subject to puromycin selection. A stable clone was selected which expressed Fry at levels comparable to the non-transformed normal mammary epithelial cell line, MCF10A. We termed the selected clone, 231wCFry.

contact_institute: The University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey
data_processing: The data were generated using the Affymetrix Scanner according to Affymetrix protocol. The intensities are from MAS5.0
description: MDA-MB-231 breast tumor epithelial cells stably transfected with the wild-type Cop Fry allele
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from 70% confluent cell cultures using the RNeasy (QIAGEN) kit.
growth_protocol_ch1: Cell cultures were maintained at 37°C in a humidified atmosphere of 5% CO2 and 95% air. MDA-MB-231 and 231wCFry cells were cultured in Advanced DMEM with 10% heat inactivated FBS, 100 μg/ml penicillin-streptomycin solution.
hyb_protocol: SPIA product and fragmented cDNA are analyzed by electrophoresis using the Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100 to assess the appropriate size distribution prior to microarray hybridization. 3.75ug of amplified and labeled cDNA was used in the hybridization cocktail for GeneChip analysis. Detailed protocols for sample preparation suing the NuGEN Ovation amplification and labeling kits can be found at http://www.nugeninc.com.
label_protocol_ch1: Microarray experiments (GEO Accession numbers pending paper acceptance) were performed by the Bionomics Research and Technology Center at EOHSI (UMDNJ, Piscataway, NJ). Forty nanograms of total RNA from each sample were used to generate a high fidelity cDNA for array hybridization.  The cDNA were amplified, fragmented and labeled with biotin using NuGEN Ovation Amplification and Labeling kit V2 (NuGEN, San Diago, CA).
scan_protocol: All samples were subjected to gene expression analysis via the Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 high-density oligonucleotide array which currently queries over 47,000 transcripts.  Hybridization, staining and washing of all arrays were performed in the Affymetrix fluidics module as per the manufacturer’s protocol.  Streptavidin phycroerythrin stain (SAPE, Molecular Probes) was the fluorescent conjugate used to detect hybridized target sequences. The detection and quantitation of target hybridization was performed with a GeneArray Scanner 3000 (Affymetrix) All arrays referred to in this study were assessed for “array performance” prior to data analysis.

contact_address: 359 FSHN Bldg. Newell Dr. PO Box 110370
contact_department: Food Science and Human Nutrition Department, Center for Nutritional Sciences
data_processing: Probes with detection P-values above 0.05 in all samples were excluded from the dataset by the Illumina GenomeStudio software. Absolute signal intensities of the filtered probes were quantile normalized using EXPANDER 5.2 (Ulitsky I et al. 2010, Nat Protoc. 2010;5:303-22).
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA from whole blood collected in PAXgene tubes (BD) was extracted using the Qiagen Rneasy kit according to manufactuer's instructions. Globin RNA contents in the isolated whole blood RNA was reduced by the GLOBINclear kit (Ambion). Purity and integrity of yielded RNA were assessed with the NanoDrop spectrophotometer and Agilent Bioanalyzer, respectively.
hyb_protocol: Standard Illumina hybridization protocol
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared with the Illumina TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion)
scan_protocol: Standard Illumina scanning protocol
source_name_ch1: Human peripheral blood, zinc depleted, 6 d
title: ZnD-6d_PAX_pooled
treatment_protocol_ch1: In order to establish a defined baseline condition prior to dietary zinc depletion, subjects consumed meals composed of a mixed diet providing ~11 mg Zn/d for 7 d. An egg white-based liquid formula which provided <0.5 mg Zn/d was consumed during the following 10 d for acute dietary zinc depletion.

data_processing: CEL files were exported to Affymetrix Expression Console Version 1.1 and RMA normalization was carried out. [The data were also  analyzed with Microarray Suite version 5.0 (MAS 5.0) using GeneChip Operating Software (GCOS, Affymetrix, CA, USA). For absolute analysis, each chip was normalized to a target intensity of 500, and probe sets were assigned a signal intensity and detection call of Present, Marginal or Absent (See MAS5_GCOS_analyzed.txt on GSE29885)]
description: Gene expression data from ramified microglia isolated from corpus callosum of 4-week rat brain
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from 600 microglia cells isolated by Laser-capture microdissection using RNeasy micro kit according to the manufacturer's instructions.
hyb_protocol: The labeled cRNA was then cleaned up, fragmented, and hybridized to Rat Genome 230 2.0 Array (Cat. No. 900506, Affymetrix, CA, USA).
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA (15ng) was reverse transcripted into the first-strand cDNA using a T7-Oligo (dT) Primer (Two-Cycle Target Labeling and Control Reagent package, Affymetrix, CA, USA). After second-strand cDNA synthesis, the double-stranded cDNA was purified and served as a template in the first cycle of in vitro transcription (IVT) reaction. The unlabeled cRNA was then reverse transcripted into the first-strand cDNA of the second cycle using random primers. Subsequently, the T7-Oligo(dT) Promoter Primer was used in the second-strand cDNA synthesis to generate double-stranded cDNA template containing T7 promoter sequences. Then the double-stranded cDNA was amplified and labeled using a biotinylated nucleotide analog/ribonucleotide mix in the second IVT reaction.
scan_protocol: The arrays were stained according to the manufacturer's protocols and then scanned with the Genechip scanner (Affymetrix, CA, USA).
title: Ramified microglia from 4-week rat brain biological rep1

data_processing: CEL files were exported to Affymetrix Expression Console Version 1.1 and RMA normalization was carried out.
